knowledges.title: Knowledges
knowledges.description: List of the things I know and have experience with.

contents.title: C++
contents.description: High-performance, general-purpose programming language with object-oriented features. Like a lot the precise control over resources.

contents.title: Java
contents.description: Platform-independent, object-oriented programming language. A little bit too verbose for me.

contents.title: C#
contents.description: versatile, object-oriented programming language, seamless integration with the .NET ecosystem. My go to language. Clear syntax, easy to use, easy to debug, easy to compile, easy to deploy.

contents.title: Python
contents.description: High-level, interpreted programming language renowned for its readability, simplicity, and extensive libraries. I do like all the small syntax tricks.

contents.title: TypeScript
contents.description: Dynamic, versatile language essential for web development, known for its ease of use and extensive ecosystem. Everything is easy to do, and so is making bad design choices.

contents.title: HTML/CSS
contents.description: HTML structures content on the web, while CSS styles and layouts that content.

contents.title: Astro.js
contents.description: Modern static site builder focused on performance and simplicity. Totally onboard with the UI-agnostic and the flexibility.

contents.title: Webpack
contents.description: Module bundler that optimizes and manages dependencies, enhancing performance and simplifying the development process. Should be used on every medium and big project.

contents.title: Vite
contents.description: Modern build tool that leverages native ES modules and a lightning-fast development server. Simpler and faster than webpack. I really like it :)

contents.title: Vuejs
contents.description: Progressive JavaScript framework known for its simplicity, flexibility, and reactivity. A good balance between complexity and simplicity.

contents.title: Angular
contents.description: Platform for building scalable, high-performance web applications. Well structured but more complexe than Vuejs.

contents.title: SvelteKit
contents.description: versatile application framework built on Svelte, offering server-side rendering, routing. For fast, efficient web applications with minimal boilerplate.

contents.title: MySQL
contents.description: Open-source relational database management system known for its reliability, performance, and ease of use. Nothing special to say about it (which is kinda a compliment).

contents.title: SQL Server
contents.description: Robust, enterprise-grade relational database management system known for its high performance, scalability, and advanced features.

contents.title: MongoDB
contents.description: Open-source NoSQL database known for its flexibility, scalability, and ability to handle large volumes of unstructured data.

contents.title: Keras
contents.description: High-level, user-friendly neural networks API, written in Python and capable of running on top of TensorFlow, CNTK, or Theano.

contents.title: Tensorflow
contents.description: Open-source machine learning framework, known for its comprehensive ecosystem, scalability, and flexibility.

contents.title: Docker
contents.description: Platform that automates the deployment, scaling, and management of applications using containerization. Nice to create complete development environments.

contents.title: Maui
contents.description: Cross-platform framework for building native applications on mobile and desktop platforms. A lot of different problems that still need to be issued.

contents.title: WPF
contents.description: Powerful UI framework for building rich, interactive desktop applications on Windows, featuring a flexible layout system, data binding, and advanced graphics capabilities. The XAML syntax is a little bit heavy for me.

contents.title: JavaFX
contents.description: Modern UI toolkit for building rich, cross-platform desktop applications with a focus on high-performance graphics, a flexible layout system, and a comprehensive set of controls.

contents.title: SDL2
contents.description: Cross-platform development library designed for low-level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware.

contents.title: SFML
contents.description: Cross-platform library for creating games and multimedia applications, offering a simple API for handling graphics, audio, input, and more. Great way to start with game development.

contents.title: Electron
contents.description: Cross-platform desktop applications using web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, combining the Chromium rendering engine and the Node.js runtime.

contents.title: .NET ASP (Framework / Core)
contents.description: Open-source web framework for building modern, scalable, and high-performance web applications and services, featuring a rich set of tools and libraries. Sometime a little bit too magical for me.

contents.title: Laravel
contents.description: Open-source web framework for building modern, scalable, and high-performance web applications and services, featuring a rich set of tools and libraries. The documentation is great, base project architecture taught me a lot.

contents.title: Nginx
contents.description: High-performance, open-source web server and reverse proxy known for its scalability, reliability, and efficient handling of concurrent connections.

contents.title: Apache
contents.description: Widely-used, open-source web server known for its reliability, flexibility, and extensive feature set.

contents.title: Node.js
contents.description: Open-source JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, enabling server-side and networking applications with an event-driven, non-blocking I/O mode.

contents.title: Express.js
contents.description: Minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications, known for its simplicity, ease of use, and extensive middleware support.

contents.title: Fastify.js
contents.description: Highly performant and low-overhead web framework for Node.js, designed for building fast and scalable APIs with a focus on speed, efficiency, and developer productivity. Greate alternative to Express.js.

contents.title: Lumen
contents.description: Micro-framework by Laravel, designed for building fast, lightweight APIs and microservices with minimal configuration.

contents.title: Slim
contents.description: Lightweight, powerful PHP micro-framework designed for building simple yet robust web applications and APIs, known for its minimalistic design, ease of use, and flexibility.

contents.title: OpenAPI / Swagger
contents.description: Open-source framework for designing, building, documenting, and consuming RESTful web services, known for its comprehensive toolset, including Swagger UI for interactive API documentation.

experimentations.title: Experimentations
experimentations.description: List of the things I experimented with, but didn't made a full project with.

contents.title: rust
contents.description: Programming language known for its memory safety, performance, and concurrency support, offering a modern syntax. Peculiar syntax, need some time to be used to.

contents.title: Kotlin
contents.description: Modern, statically typed programming language that runs on the JVM, known for its concise syntax, interoperability with Java, and powerful features like null safety and coroutines.

contents.title: Swift
contents.description: Powerful, intuitive programming language developed by Apple for building iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS applications, known for its modern syntax, safety features, and performance. I like a lot the storyboard concept. The only downside is that it's only for Apple.

contents.title: Tauri
contents.description: Framework for building smaller, faster, and more secure desktop applications using web technologies, combining a minimal Rust-based backend with a frontend built with any web framework. Nice alternative to Electron, but still in early development.

contents.title: Flutter
contents.description: Open-source UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase. Not realy fan of the fact that it's really easy to mix logic and UI.

contents.title: Avalonia UI
contents.description: Cross-platform, open-source .NET UI framework that enables the creation of modern, responsive desktop applications for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

contents.title: Apache cordova
contents.description: Open-source mobile development framework that allows developers to build cross-platform mobile applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, wrapping them in native containers to access device-specific features and APIs.

contents.title: Ionic
contents.description: Open-source framework for building cross-platform mobile and web applications using web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, known for its rich UI components, performance. A lot of nice prebuilt components.

contents.title: React
contents.description: Popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces, known for its component-based architecture, declarative syntax, and efficient virtual DOM. The syntax is heavy (God forbid JSX and states).

contents.title: Nuxt
contents.description: Open-source framework built on top of Vue.js, designed for creating server-side rendered (SSR) and statically generated web applications.

contents.title: Ultralight.cpp
contents.description: Lightweight, high-performance HTML renderer and UI toolkit for C++, designed for embedding web technologies in desktop applications.

contents.title: Redis
contents.description: Open-source, in-memory data structure store known for its high performance, flexibility, and support for various data types, making it ideal for caching, real-time analytics, and fast data access.

contents.title: AppWrite
contents.description: Open-source backend server that provides developers with a set of easy-to-use APIs for managing authentication, databases, storage, and more, enabling rapid development of modern web and mobile applications.

certifications.name: CCNA
certifications.description: CCNA 2 : Switching, Routing, and Wireless Essentials

educations.name: Master's degree in Computer Science
educations.description: Major in Software Engineering specialized in cybersecurity
